title: Blawpaw
author: Blawpaw
content: Great news for the crypto community!It looks like PayPal has unapologetically joined the crypto world! The Industry leader announced it was opening crypto services in the coming days through its Luxemburg branch. PayPal users in the country will be able to buy and sell cryptos through their EU- Based PayPal accounts. "The introduction of this service offers Luxembourgish customers a new way to explore cryptocurrency in the PayPal environment they know and trust and provides customers access to educational content to help answer commonly asked questions and better understand the opportunities and risks associated with cryptocurrencies. Once available, eligible customers will be able to buy, sell and hold Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin and Bitcoin Cash in their PayPal accounts via the website or the mobile app. PayPal’s cryptocurrency services were first launched in the U.S. in 2020 and expanded to the U.K. in 2021."

comments.author: blockman
comments.body: I think the news is specific to the Luxembourg people because as you've said and it's known that PayPal have also included crypto 2 years ago. And it's just like integrated support to crypto with their services and as they launch, you can't send and receive and withdraw crypto directly on your PayPal but are only allowed to trade, buy and sell within their platform. But, this is good news then for those people that are in the UK. They're expanding and if so, PayPal is missing a lot of market on this one since Binance and other exchanges have been there.

comments.body: Paypal has been doing this for years already as they realized the demand for crypto and adopting it might benefit them a lot. Paypal is doing things slowly but surely and focusing in one area with a great demand for crypto is a good strategy. This is a good development from Paypal and hopefully they’ll also introduce this to many countries and make things more possible, this is a good news for every Paypal users.

comments.author: n0ne
comments.body: This is for specific location. Long back itself it have widened it's service with cryptocurrency addition. We haven't got a big list of cryptocurrencies, but initially bitcoin, ethereum, bitcoin cash and Litecoin were availed for buying, selling and transferring through PayPal. Years back co-founder of PayPal Peter Thiel mentioned in an interview, if he have come to know about the existence of blockchain technology before PayPal, he would've used it in the PayPal. So, a good support from PayPal to crypto is not a new thing.
